title: Very good could be better.
comment: Needs more colours. Would be perfect if you could pick colours by code. I would also like if you could chose the size of the canvas.                      There's a few pros: The pen pressure sensitivity is the best I've seen but there's a lot of blotted areas which isn't too big of a problem. I also really enjoy the fact that you can choose the size of the tool by number. The app seems pretty easy to use overall. As an artist of several years (I've done lots of digital art) I see that this app has potential

title: Very simple yet powerful!

title: Just one big fix!
comment: This app has so much potential! The idea is brilliant, and it works like a charm. There's just one huge issue: the marker size. I have absolutely no idea how the sizing works. There's no way of knowing which end you're working on, not to mention the fact that you can't tell whether it's getting larger or smaller. I most often wind up crashing only to realise that I'm at size 128 on the wrong end when I come back.If we could only put in the numbers numerically, this would be five-star in a heartbeat!

title: Markers - good but could be even better

Perhaps the developer can add the ability to adjust via numerical point entry. That would add a whole lot of user friendliness to this, otherwise, friendly app.

title: Improving
comment: This app is Improving at a great Pace.  It's a Fantastic open-source resource and will hopefully continue to improve and inspire more and Better android Drawing APPS.
Pressure change only registered when pen lifted of and put down again.	On my hp slate 8 pro it works fine but pressure changes only happen when i stop drawing and then start again. :-(

This might be peculiar to the HP slate—I've never tested this device. If you turn on debug mode and look at the number to the left of the little dot graph, does it change as you move your finger? Please use the "Email Developer" link below or report a bug at http://dsandler.org/markers . Thanks!

title: HTC Flyer
comment: Loving using this app with my HTC Flyer pen, but I'm having some problems:    The app won't rotate into landscape mode. Obviously it's not too difficult to draw with the app "sideways," but since some of the screenshots are in landscape I assume the app should support this.    The drag-to-resize brush size seems to be acting up. The size always comes up a lot smaller or a lot bigger than I was expecting (like, 0.4, or 256.) Maybe if there were some way to see what the size will be before you release the pen?

• Landscape is currently only supported on "big" tablets.
• The brush size control should update live—is that not what you're seeing? If so, please file a bug at http://dsandler.org/markers .
I

title: Very Nice, But Limited For My Tastes.
comment: The user interface for this app is very attractive, and the brush strokes are smooth and consistent.  Overall for what is currently in the app, the app is perfect, sort of.  If everything currently offered feature-wise, is your cup of tea, then you'd be hard pressed to find a better alternative I believe.  And while I enjoy the app, my needs and wants for a comprehensive drawing app, well they are greater and more demanding.  I realize this isn't supposed to be the very top tier overall drawing app, but to me it's lacking some essential tools.  I believe it could benefit from these additions - a full-fledged color picker/swatch, the ability to adjust the opacity of your chosen color and marker, an on the fly, pinch-to-zoom in and out function, without having to select a menu button, just pinch in, push out to zoom, a sizing option for your marker strokes, and a few other features.  I believe everything I listed, are essential and to me, vital, features and functions that all drawing/painting applications should have as default.  Perhaps my needs are more sophisticated, I don't know, I just get frustrated by quite a few things missing.  But, it's still a great app, that works well.

Using only colour markers with different sizes and a few levels of opacity encourages you to be bold and creative from the first stroke to the last. Like picking up a pad and just sketching. title: People are dumb.
comment: The checkered background means that it is transparent, so when it saves as a black picture, it's because the default background on your phone is black. My requests to the developer are a custom color palette and a paint bucket tool.  Layer support would be awesome aswell.

title: Misleading description
comment: Misleading as all hell. It's not pressure sensitive. It can just tell whether or not you've got a higher surface area touching the screen. If you press down with a stylus with any amount of pressure, the surface area doesn't change, and this isn't reflected in the app.  All this aside, it's still a decent drawing app, even though it's rather lacking in any features.

comment: This app does one thing and it does it well. Great for doodles and sketching ideas.
Awesome!!
Pretty neat

title: Thanks DS!
comment: You rock!

title: Great App
comment: I have no artistic ability, but this is just so much fun to play with. Would absolutely love a feature to import a photo as a reference to draw over to create marker styled versions of photos on my phone.

title: awesome!
comment: just in time to capitalize on the hordes of folks leaving draw something because they are tired of drawing ads.  Plus, a superior interface.  The pressure-sensitive brushes work very well.  Runs smoothly on my Galaxy Nexus so far.  Nice app!  With an easy-sharing feature, people could do their own "draw something" by just sending pictures between their friends.  ideas for future features: 1. Image-sharing capability built in 2. More colors (maybe there is already a way to alter the palette, didn't look that closely) 3. Multiple levels of undo

title: Drawing App
comment: Great drawing app, with the pressure sensitivity you can write in calligraphy!
Fantastic App!

title: Awesome
comment: Thanks for making this available!

title: Great little drawing tool
comment: Markers is a wonderful lightweight drawing tool. It's fast, easy, and the pressure sensitivity is second to none, even the high-end apps you pay for. It doesn't have a lot of fancy features: it's designed to be simple and easy to use. It's for doodlers, not artistes.  The only thing that could make this app any better is if I had artistic talent.

title: Great app! Thank you for making it free!
comment: Can't believe the pressure sensitivity
